articles.title: The deadly cancer hiding in plain sight — and why most patients never get screened

neutral.headline: Experts Suggest Expanding Lung Cancer Screening Criteria
neutral.body:
A recent study conducted by researchers has indicated that the existing guidelines for lung cancer screening may not be capturing a significant portion of patients who are at risk. According to the study findings, approximately 65% of individuals with lung cancer may be missed by the current screening criteria. This has prompted experts to suggest a potential need for broader, age-based screening protocols to identify and treat more cases of lung cancer at an earlier stage.
The study highlights the importance of reassessing and potentially expanding the screening guidelines to ensure that a larger number of individuals with lung cancer are detected early on, when treatment outcomes are typically more favorable. By considering universal age-based screening, healthcare providers may be able to reach a broader segment of the population at risk for lung cancer and potentially save more lives.
While further research and discussions are needed to determine the most effective approach to improving lung cancer screening, the findings of this study serve as a reminder of the ongoing importance of evaluating and updating medical guidelines to better meet the healthcare needs of the population.

articles.title: Retro coffee on rise with younger drinkers despite vision concerns: Here's what experts say

neutral.headline: Study Suggests Potential Link Between Instant Coffee Consumption and Macular Degeneration Risk
neutral.body:
A recent study has raised concerns about a potential association between instant coffee consumption and an increased risk of macular degeneration, a leading cause of vision loss. While the findings point to a possible connection, it is important to interpret them with caution and consider additional research before drawing definitive conclusions.
Macular degeneration is a serious eye condition that can lead to central vision loss and impact daily activities such as reading and driving. The study, which focused on younger individuals who consume instant coffee regularly, highlights the importance of understanding the potential impact of dietary choices on eye health.
It is crucial for consumers to be aware of the potential risks associated with their beverage choices and to make informed decisions about their coffee consumption habits. While instant coffee may offer convenience and affordability, individuals should consider moderation and explore other options to support overall eye health.
Further research is needed to fully understand the relationship between instant coffee consumption and macular degeneration risk. In the meantime, individuals are encouraged to speak with their healthcare providers about any concerns regarding their eye health and to maintain a balanced diet that supports optimal vision.
